title: The U.S. could hit the debt ceiling by June 1, much sooner than expected, Yellen warns
description: The U.S. could fail to meet its debt obligations sooner than expected, adding pressure to stalled talks between the White House and Congress.

title: 'Godfather of A.I.' leaves Google after a decade to warn society of technology he's touted
description: Geoffrey Hinton, known as the "godfather of A.I." is leaving his role at Google, and plans to warn about the risks of the technology he's promoted.

title: Bitcoin pulls back to start May as First Republic Bank saga comes to an end
description: Crypto fell to start May as investors bet the takeover of First Republic Bank could put an end to the financial crisis.

title: Scientists develop A.I. system focused on turning peoples' thoughts into text
description: Scientists have developed a noninvasive AI system focused on translating a person's brain activity into a stream of text.

title: Facebook was the main donor to a group that fought antitrust reforms in 2020 and 2021
description: Facebook donated $34 million to pro-tech industry group American Edge Project as the nonprofit took on antitrust legislation.

title: FAA sued over SpaceX Starship launch program following April explosion
description: The FAA is sued by environmental groups over SpaceX Starship Super Heavy launch.

title: Mastering this skill is the ‘hardest part’ of personal finance, advisors say
description: Being a "master of cash flow" is an important foundational step households should consider addressing before they invest.

title: The First Republic deal has come at a crucial point for the markets and economy
description: With financial services covering such a wide swath of activities in the $26.5 trillion U.S. economy, the bank failures will reverberate.

title: The Federal Reserve is expected to hike rates one more time. What that means for you
description: This could mark the 10th time the Fed has raised its benchmark interest rate over the past year or so. Here's what that means to your wallet.

title: Lordstown Motors warns of bankruptcy after Foxconn threatens to walk away from crucial funding deal
description: After buying Lordstown's factory last year, Foxconn agreed to invest an additional $170 million. That deal is now in jeopardy, the embattled startup said.

title: Jamie Dimon says 'this part of the crisis is over' after JPMorgan Chase buys First Republic
description: JPMorgan Chase, which acquired banking assets in the 2008 financial crisis, just won an auction to gain even more size with the takeover of First Republic.

title: JPMorgan takes over First Republic after it's seized by Californian financial regulator
description: JPMorgan acquired all of First Republic's deposits and a "substantial majority of assets." Its shares rose 2.6% in premarket trading on the news.

title: PlayStation, treasure hunts and natural wonders: What life is like onboard a giant oil tanker
description: Seafarers describe the highs and lows of spending months on the ocean.

title: Italy signed up to China's Belt and Road Initiative. Now it's having second thoughts
description: Italy has previously been described as a "middle-power" bridge used by Beijing and Moscow to strike deals.

title: Germany has a plan to tackle a rapidly ageing workforce: recruiting robots
description: Germany has an aging population, so hiring robots and widespread digitalization could be key in solving the country's labor shortage crisis.

title: Planning a solo trip to South Korea? Here are some places that cater to singles in Seoul
description: More people in South Korea are choosing to dine, drink and travel alone — embracing the "honjok" lifestyle trend that has visibly taken root in the country.

title: Most people aren't honest in exit interviews — the default is bull----, says NYU professor
description: "Think about this as a way for you to learn how to have an uncomfortable feedback conversation, and you can practice on your ex-employer," said Tessa West.
